title: Accelerated Chemistry - Integrated: 6th Grade, 7th Grade, 8th Grade
subject: Science (2016-)

document.title: Arkansas K-12 Science Standards Accelerated Science Course Pathway Chemistry - Integrated

32C477338ED14699B9EC89AF96738B46.description:
Use a computer simulation to model the impact of proposed solutions to a complex realworld problem with numerous criteria and constraints on interactions within and between
systems relevant to the problem.

3F1581F55D9B4261B3CDFE6C1350A848.description:
Evaluate a solution to a complex real-world problem based on prioritized criteria and tradeoffs that account for a range of constraints, including cost, safety, reliability, and aesthetics,
as well as possible social, cultural, and environmental impacts.

75A164576AA84AB3BB7E4327DFE84B47.description:
Use mathematical representations to support the kinetic molecular relationships between
 pressure, volume and temperature of a gas sample.

D8F2BAD8309E4331A042B5F41830D2AF.description:
Design a solution to a complex real-world problem by breaking it down into smaller, more
 manageable problems that can be solved through engineering.

C5398253234E4CED8BDD19EC29864BCF.description:
Evaluate evidence of the past and current movements of continental and oceanic crust and
 the theory of plate tectonics to explain the ages of crustal rocks.

9A090D2D48154A5DA61E3D604E6B8873.description:
Use mathematical or computational representations to predict the motion of orbiting objects
 in the solar system.

45ACC800C6C540CA96D72AD361D360CC.description:
Develop and use a model of two objects interacting through electric or magnetic fields to
 illustrate the forces between objects and the changes in energy of the objects due to the
interaction.

F1C0F23A92A548E5AF1432807104FE26.description:
Use mathematical representations of Newton’s Law of Gravitation and Coulomb’s Law to
 describe and predict the gravitational and electrostatic forces between objects.

9F937183E1B149CA8163BCEA24B606C1.description:
Use mathematical representations to support the claim that the total momentum of a system
 of objects is conserved when there is no net force on the system.

A3E632FB16694AB89229A9D574600509.description:
Analyze data to support the claim that Newton’s second law of motion describes the
 mathematical relationship among the net force on a macroscopic object, its mass, and its
acceleration.

F47AD024F8314C6080CA5BB7D35EDA04.description:
Use a computer simulation to model the impact of proposed solutions to a complex real-
 world problem with numerous criteria and constraints on interactions within and between
 systems relevant to the problem.

9113054A3B344046A42081BBE827DA98.description:
Communicate technical information about how some technological devices use the
 principles of wave behavior and wave interactions with matter to transmit and capture
information and energy.*

05BB9694A08B455F93FF3777E9043696.description:
Evaluate the validity and reliability of claims in published materials of the effects that
 different frequencies of electromagnetic radiation have when absorbed by matter.

E858D3A3AD404D569F0D0CB0AD5779D5.description:
Evaluate the claims, evidence, and reasoning behind the idea that electromagnetic
 radiation can be described either by a wave model or a particle model, and that for some
situations one model is more useful than the other.

9BF5B9A323B44E0DA25631F779B2CC0B.description:
Use mathematical representations to support a claim regarding relationships among the
frequency, wavelength, and speed of waves traveling in various media.

84CAD575703E44B1ADE8EFECF9850FE6.description:
Analyze a major global challenge to specify qualitative and quantitative criteria and
 constraints for solutions that account for societal needs and wants.

6ADD55A20E904A52A5A8D3A49CE2055E.description:
Evaluate or refine a technological solution that reduces impacts of human activities on natural
 systems.*

8C679380C149409DA898C545A2466DC6.description:
Develop a model based on evidence of Earth’s interior to describe the cycling of matter by
 thermal convection.

C0FCBFDD84A040A38E6DE3B4FDC358FC.description:
Construct an explanation of the Big Bang theory based on astronomical evidence of light
 spectra, motion of distant galaxies, and composition of matter in the universe.

5C282A2C81E2486CB4F4FC1652AF04C7.description:
Create a computational model to calculate the change in the energy of one component in a
 system when the change in energy of the other component(s) and energy flows in and out of
the system are known.

81F920515E834F6B91F1F9406E56A6A0.description:
Apply scientific principles and evidence to provide an explanation about the effects of
 changing the temperature or concentration of the reacting particles on the rate at which a
reaction occurs.

4F8D6C6EFF254228B5D6C0A6744A8001.description:
Develop a model to illustrate that the release or absorption of energy from a chemical reaction
 system depends upon the changes in total bond energy.

EE67EF59EE5C4D07881156592CAC0C77.description:
Use a computer simulation to model the impact of proposed solutions to a complex real-world
 problem with numerous criteria and constraints on interactions within and between systems
relevant to the problem

86AD2F488088494FB4B5EF32424CE51E.description:
Evaluate a solution to a complex real-world problem based on prioritized criteria and trade-
 offs that account for a range of constraints, including cost, safety, reliability, and aesthetics,
as well as possible social, cultural, and environmental impacts. [

EFBB2231E6A843D98291ABA9A8E7171C.description:
Design a solution to a complex real-world problem by breaking it down into smaller, more
manageable problems that can be solved through engineering.

CDDF2BEAEDE44230B9AF3E66A0E4ACBE.description:
Analyze a major global challenge to specify qualitative and quantitative criteria and
 constraints for solutions that account for societal needs and wants.

0418090AC8154A55863A3047AD6F473F.description:
Apply scientific reasoning and evidence from ancient Earth materials, meteorites, and other
 planetary surfaces to construct an account of Earth’s formation and early history.

6B4F950892C64DFC9A4081F945A220CB.description: Communicate scientific ideas about the way stars, over their life cycle, produce elements.

FE8C0F7A33914D7FA57B1D970582CF5D.description:
Develop a model based on evidence to illustrate the life span of the sun and the role of
 nuclear fusion in the sun’s core to release energy that eventually reaches Earth in the form of
radiation.

92242B8674A14CBBA682E488B9187B17.description:
Develop models to illustrate the changes in the composition of the nucleus of the atom and
 the energy released during the processes of fission, fusion, and radioactive decay.

3A886B88137C4158BD61F3B3996E793D.description:
Design a solution to a complex real-world problem by breaking it down into smaller, more
manageable problems that can be solved through engineering.

67042EE979314B598F5DDF9EAACB468C.description:
Plan and conduct an investigation of the properties of water and its effects on Earth materials
 and surface processes.

0D5B585EFF0C4B40AD1286EB91AD6F89.description:
Use mathematical representations to support the claim that atoms, and therefore mass, are
conserved during a chemical reaction.

583B78EA974748F381C6FA2187652521.description:
Refine the design of a chemical system by specifying a change in conditions that
 would produce increased amounts of products at equilibrium.*

E1DE823FE5C34E1BB45F9B4BF00365FC.description:
Plan and conduct an investigation to gather evidence to compare the structure of substances
 at the bulk scale to infer the strength of electrical forces between particles.

F8FD4C8338484C2782C305C2337B764E.description:
Construct and revise an explanation for the outcome of a simple chemical reaction based on
the outermost electron states of atoms, trends in the periodic table, and knowledge of the
patterns of chemical properties.

565CF930F8DE4263A6A31BFBA4F26685.description:
Construct and revise models representing coulombic interactions among molecular electron
domains that produce stable molecular arrangements

357539BBC9C64EC4BFA78C98AC827C76.description:
Use the periodic table as a model to predict the relative properties of elements based on the
patterns of electrons in the outermost energy level of atoms.
